headline: PayPal Wants to Turn Small Retailers Into Amazon Ads. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Shares of  PayPal Holdings  jumped on Tuesday after the digital payments company unveiled an advertising-management platform for small businesses.  PayPal Ads Manager will allow companies that use PayPal to create their own retail media networks, or RMNs, industry-speak for merchant-owned ad spaces.  “We’re enabling small businesses to participate in the same high-margin advertising model that’s powering growth at some of the largest companies in the world,” said Mark Grether, the general manager of PayPal Ads.

raw.headline: PayPal Wants to Turn Small Retailers Into Amazon Ads. The Stock Is Rising.

headline: Chomps Takes a Bite Out of Barriers to Growth with NetSuite
summary: SuiteWorld -- Chomps, a leading snack brand known for its high-quality meat sticks, is using Oracle NetSuite to support its mission of delivering convenient and accessible snacks made with real ingredients. With NetSuite's unified business management suite, Chomps has been able to increase the speed and accuracy of financial processes, maximize visibility across its business, and establish a scalable foundation to support its continued growth.

headline: Is Walmart Stock Priced Fairly After New Pallet Sensors Announcement in 2025?
summary: If you’re sizing up what to do with Walmart stock right now, you’re not alone. Even the savviest investors are wondering if the world’s largest retailer is still a buy, especially after the kind of run Walmart has had. Over the past year, shares have risen 31.1% and have more than doubled over five years, posting a 129.0% gain. So, what’s fueling this momentum? Part of it comes from Walmart’s drive into next-level logistics, such as using sensors to track grocery pallets, and the company’s...

headline: IKEA buys US logistics tech firm Locus in online growth push
summary: LONDON/STOCKHOLM (Reuters) -IKEA has acquired U.S. logistics technology firm Locus, the two companies said on Tuesday, a deal the Swedish furniture retailer said would make its deliveries to shoppers smoother and faster as it invests to expand online sales.  The takeover is in addition to a $2.2 billion push by Ingka Group, the biggest global IKEA franchisee, in the U.S. where it competes with Wayfair and Walmart and is also contending with higher tariffs on imports that are increasing its costs.  IKEA declined to disclose the value of the deal.

The takeover is in addition to a $2.2 billion push by Ingka Group, the biggest global IKEA franchisee, in the U.S. where it competes with Wayfair and Walmart and is also contending with higher tariffs on imports that are increasing its costs.  IKEA declined to disclose the value of the deal.
